gpcm.model module¶

class gpcm.model.AbstractGPCM(*args, **kw_args)[source]¶

Bases: probmods.model.Model

GPCM model.

Parameters

scheme (str, optional) – Approximation scheme. Must be one of structured, mean-field-ca, mean-field-gradient, mean-field-collapsed-gradient, mean-field-ca-gradient, or mean-field-ca-collapsed-gradient. Defaults to structured.

elbo(*args, **kw_args)[source]¶
kernel_approx(t1, t2, u)[source]¶

Kernel approximation using inducing variables \(u\) for the impulse response \(h\).

Parameters

  • t1 (vector) – First time input.

  • t2 (vector) – Second time input.

  • u (vector) – Values of the inducing variables.

Returns

Approximation of the kernel matrix broadcasted over t1 and t2.

Return type

tensor

load(path)[source]¶

Load model from a file.

Parameters

path (str) – Path to load from.

predict(*args, **kw_args)[source]¶

Make predictions.

Parameters

  • x (tensor) – Inputs to predict at.

  • num_samples (int, optional) – Number of samples. Defaults to 100.

Returns

Predictions.

Return type

object

predict_filter(t_h=None, num_samples=1000, min_phase=True)[source]¶

Predict the learned filter.

Parameters

  • t_h (vector, optional) – Inputs to sample filter at.

  • num_samples (int, optional) – Number of samples to use. Defaults to 1000.

  • min_phase (bool, optional) – Predict a minimum-phase version of the filter. Defaults to True.

Returns

Predictions.

Return type

collections.namedtuple

predict_fourier(num_samples=1000)[source]¶

Predict Fourier features.

Parameters

num_samples (int, optional) – Number of samples to use. Defaults to 1000.

Returns

Marginals of the predictions.

Return type

tuple

predict_kernel(t_k=None, num_samples=1000)[source]¶

Predict kernel and normalise prediction.

Parameters

  • t_k (vector, optional) – Inputs to sample kernel at. Will be automatically determined if not given.

  • num_samples (int, optional) – Number of samples to use. Defaults to 1000.

Returns

The prediction.

Return type

collections.namedtuple

predict_psd(t_k=None, num_samples=1000)[source]¶

Predict the PSD in dB.

Parameters

  • t_k (vector, optional) – Inputs to sample kernel at. Will be automatically determined if not given.

  • num_samples (int, optional) – Number of samples to use. Defaults to 1000.

Returns

Predictions.

Predict kernel and normalise prediction.

Parameters

samples.
